summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 among FBI personnel discussing and approving travel expenses for an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, believed to be in Massachusetts or New Hampshire. The emails detail cost estimates, logistical planning, and the need to locate the target's phone.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in the email chain, involved in approving travel and discussing operational details for arresting a target in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: SSA - Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.context: Requests updates on the arrest operation and mentions being asked to submit an SCN (Situational Crime Notification) once the arrest occurs.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel coordinating on an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with one requesting updates and the other providing approvals and information.

events.title: Phone location analysis indicates target in New Hampshire
events.description: Historical data on the target's phone indicates it is in New Hampshire, prompting a shift in operational planning.

events.title: Travel approval for arrest operation
events.description: Approval is granted for travel expenses to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with cost estimates and logistical details discussed.
personsInvolved: SSA - Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS

keyFacts: In July 2020, the FBI was planning an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, initially believed to be in Massachusetts.
Historical phone data indicated the target's phone was in New Hampshire, requiring a shift in operational plans.
The operation involved moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating the target's phone.
Travel approval was requested and granted for approximately 3-4 FBI personnel, with estimated expenses totaling around $1060-$5525.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit was involved and requested immediate notification upon the arrest to submit a Situational Crime Notification (SCN).
